results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: A Circle is determined by three points
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
The three degrees of freedom of a circle - the radius and the co-ordinates of the centre - are reduced stage by stage until finally three points are given. Animated diagrams.

results.title: A Chronic problem
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film considers the chronic patient’s right to quality care, and the acutely ill patient’s right to a hospital bed. Jean is suffering from multiple sclerosis and is almost completely paralyzed. It seems that the only ones who care about her are the nurses. With the arrival of a patient in need of an operation, it becomes apparent that chronic patients have little priority.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Christmas Story
results.brief_description: On Christmas Eve, Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids give shelter to an out-of-town family who’s mother is about to give birth. At the same time, they try to save their clubhouse from destruction.

results.title: A Christmas story
results.creator_credit: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After the Australian Government’s 2008 introduction of a new ‘income management’ regime for Northern Territory Aboriginal Australians, many families were unable to celebrate Christmas as usual. Djuma Dawes tells how his mother and other supporters, including Rotary Australia, arranged for the delivery of 16,000 Christmas presents across the Territory, believing that ‘everyone deserves to have a Merry Christmas.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Djuma Dawes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Christmas Special with Luciano Pavarotti
results.brief_description: A glorious concert performed at the spectacular Notre Dame Cathedral, Montreal, Luciano Pavarotti’s Christmas present to music lovers everywhere. Conducted by Franz Paul Decker with “Les Petits Chanteurs” and “Les disciples de Massenmet”. Features “Christmas Medley”, “O Holy Night”, “Pieta Signore”, “Gloria”, “Silent Night”, “Ave Maria”, “Mille Cherubini in Coro”, “Agnus Dei”, “Gesu Bambino”, “Panis Angelicus”, “Oh Come All Ye Faithful”, “O Jesu Christii”, and “Hallelujah Chorus”.

results.title: A Christmas Gift (Captioned)
results.brief_description: On Christmas Eve a young boy looks into the gleaming windows where tables are laden with turkey, ducks, geese and cherry pie. Then he peers in a window lit only by candle-light. He sees a grey-haired lady sitting in front of a bare table crying so he offers to share his meagre Christmas dinner with her. The happiest Christmas was shared by candle light.

results.title: A Christmas gift
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Billy Budd Films and Film Loft Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated film by Will Vinto capturing the spirit of Christmas, where the happiest Christmas is shared by a young boy and an old lady over a simple candle-lit dinner of cheese, bread and wine. Based on the song entitled ‘Christmas Dinner’ by Paul Stookey of Peter, Paul and Mary.

results.title: A Christmas fantasy
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film depicts impressions of the lights of Christmas as they transform a winter’s night. Captures the illusive magic of a northern Christmas when fresh snow lies softly on pine trees and roof tops and multi-coloured lights glow on surfaces of purest white. The myriad lights of a city, the wonder on children’s faces, lyrical music, dramatic colour effects with trick photography - all combine to create the nostalgic mood of Christmas. (Award: Columbus)
